Translations.Text: Thereafter, We did not send an army from heavens upon his people; We did not have to
There was just a single bang, and they all were left lifeless! (As if extinguished)
What a pity! These human kinds! Their only response to the messengers _ whenever they came to them _ was to mock and make fun of them
Do they not observe? Many a town have We demolished prior to them. Verily, none of their dwellers ever return
Surely! All of them together would be presented before Us (for judgment)
And the proof for them (of the lie-to-come) is the dead land __ barren and desolate. We cause it to spring back to life! And We bring forth the grain out of it, which they eat
We dotted the land with orchards of grapes and dates, and We caused springs to gush out of the earth
That they may eat its produce! It was not they who made it all happen! So, should they not be grateful
Exalted is He Who created all things in pairs! Things that grow in fields. Things within their own selves. Even things they have no knowledge of
Another proof is the night! When We strip the day off it, they are left in the dark
The sun proceeds towards its marked destination. This is the destiny appointed by the Mightiest and the most Knowledgeable
And the moon! We destined it to return in stages until it comes back like the dried out branch of the date tree
It is not ordained for the sun to overtake the moon, nor for the night to outpace the day. Each, (the sun and the moon), is afloat in its respective orbit
Another proof for them! We surely boarded their descendants on a laden ark
And We created other similar vessels for them to sail upon
If We wish We could drown them, and no one would hear their whimper of protest! Nor would they be rescued
Except (their respite is) by Our grace, and only as merriment for a brief while
(They ignore) when they are told to beware of what lies before them and what lies ahead of them, so that they may receive mercy
They merely turn away and ignore each and every proof of their Lord that ever reaches them
When asked to spend that which Allah has granted them, those who disbelieve say to those who believe, "Shall we feed those whom Allah could have fed, had He wished? You are clearly in the wrong
And they say, "If you are truthful, tell us! When will that promise _ (the hereafter)_ be fulfilled
What they await is nothing but a single bang! They will still be busy quarreling when it will seize them in its grip
Then, they will have no chance either to make a will or to return to their families
Then the trumpet will sound. Instantly, they will leap out of their graves and begin marching towards their Lord
They shall say, "Oh misery to us! Who has aroused us out of our graves?" ........ "This is that promise! Rehman´s promise! The messengers had been truthful after all
There will just be a single bang, and suddenly, all of them together shall be arraigned before Us
That day, no being will be wronged a bit! And all of you will be repaid strictly in accordance with what you used to do
And surely, that day, those in paradise will be busy enjoying the fruits
They and their spouses will be under the cool dense shades! Seated on couches and reclining on pillows
Theirs shall be all the fruits! And anything else their hearts desire
Peace!" Their Merciful Lord shall greet them
And you, Oh criminals, stand aside! Distinct and separate, today
Oh children of Adam! Did I not have a pact with you, that you will not worship Shaitan? He is your professed enemy
And that rather, you will worship Me. That is the straight path
He (Shaitan) has indeed, taken a severe toll, and has led astray a great many of you! So, do you not ever think
This, here, is the hellfire you had been promised
Go, roast in it today! Just deserts for your denial
Today, We have sealed your lips! Your hands will speak to Us, and your feet will bear witness to all you used to do
Should We so decide, We could wipe the eyes off their faces! Will they, then, not keep groping for their path? And from where might they obtain their sight
If We want, We could squash them in their very places! Then they could neither proceed nor return
We do reverse the very nature of those to whom We give a long life! Don´t they ever think
We did not teach him (Muhammad SAW) poetry. That is beneath him! What it is (the Qur´an), is a reminder and an illuminating open book
In order that, those who are still alive may be forewarned by it! And the charge against the disbelievers may ring true
Have they not observed? We created the cattle for them! Our handiwork! Now, they own these cattle
We have tamed these cattle for them. Some they ride, others they eat
They drink their milk and derive other benefits from them! Should they not be grateful
They took gods besides Allah, so that, perhaps they may receive some help
They (false gods) will not be able to lend any help; for they would themselves be brought out (before Us, to be condemned) as their allies
Let their remarks not cause you grief. We, surely know every thing they say, that which they utter in secret, as well as that which they declare openly
Does man not know!? We created him from a speck of fluid! And now, he stands defiantly before Us __argumentative and boisterous
Hurls insults at Us, and forgets his own origin, and says, "Who will bring these bones back to life when they have withered away
Say! The One Who created them in the first place will bring them back to life. He is Well-versed in all means and manners of creation
He lets the green trees produce fire for you. So now, with it you kindle the flame
Could the Creator of the heavens and the earth not be capable of creating the likes of them? Most definitely! He is All-knowing, and the Greatest, most Versatile Creator
He has commanded it so; whenever He intends anything to be, He says to it ´Be!´ and it becomes
Exalted is He, in Whose hands is the destiny of all things and towards Whom you all must return
(Allah swears by the angels), those who stand in rows, awaiting orders, keeping ranks
They restrain (and rebuke the unbelievers) constantly
And carry and convey the word _ (the inspiration and revelation from Allah)
(Allah proclaims that) certainly, your God is the Absolute One
The Lord of the heavens and the earth and everything in between, the Lord of each and every point of sunrise (the Lord of the Easts)
Indeed, We brightened the heaven (the sky) of this world with beautiful stars
Then screened and shielded it against every defiant Shaitan
These Shaitans are chased out of everywhere as they attempt to eavesdrop on the conversation of the exalted angels (to learn about the events to come)
These Shaitans are outcasts. Theirs is the perpetual punishment
If one (of the Shaitans) succeeds in snatching away a fragment (of knowledge), a piercing flame follows him (in hot pursuit)
Just ask their (the disbelievers´) opinion. What is harder to create? They, or the other things We have created? We created them from sticky clay
In fact, (Oh prophet)! you are struck with awe, while they just mock
And when advised, they do not heed
When shown the sign, they scoff and laugh it off
And respond, "This is evidently just magic
Is it possible? Once we die and wither away into dust and bones, would we really be brought back to life
And our forefathers, too
Say, "Yes! Of course you (all) would! You would be humbled
In fact, it will take just a single hoot (and rebuke), and at once they shall (wake up and) stare
They will say, "Oh misery to us, this is the Day of Judgment
(They will hear the reply), "This is the day of the verdict you used to reject
(Allah will order the angels): Gather together all the evildoers, their wives and also those (deities) they used to worship
Instead of Allah! Then, shove them along the path towards the blazing fire
But detain them for a while! First, they must answer
What is wrong with you? Why are you not helping each other out, (today)
In fact, that day they shall (concede and) give in so sheepishly
Right then, they will confront and accuse each other
Some will say to others, "You (swore and) came to us (feigning sincerity); you had (an imposing) status over us
Others will reply, "Not so at all! You were disbelievers yourselves
We had no control over you. You were certainly a defiant people
So (now), in our case the prediction of our Lord has come to pass. We (both of us) shall have to taste (the torment)
We led you astray, but we too, were (lost and) on the wrong path
On that day, they shall all share that torment together
This is really the way We shall deal with the criminals
They used to scorn and scoff arrogantly when told that there is no god except Allah
They said, "Should we give up our gods for the sake of an obsessed poet
On the contrary, he brought them the absolute truth; it confirmed the (teachings of the previous) messengers
(You did not accept), so you definitely have to taste the painful punishment
You will be punished strictly in accordance with what you had done
But the sincere and obedient servants of Allah (will be safe)
The known rewards (and riches) will be theirs
Fruits (of all kinds)! They will be the honored (residents)
In the blessings filled paradise
Seated on elevated thrones, facing each other
Cups filled with drinks from the fountains (of paradise) will be passed around among them
White (wine)! A delicious and delectable drink
It will neither inebriate; nor cause a hangover
(They will be) accompanied by chaste and demure females, with eyes only for their mates
So dainty and delicate; like a thin film lining the eggshell
(Surrounded by such luxuries) they will face each other and converse
One of them would say to others, "I had a friend
He used to say (to me): are you also one of those who believe
That we would be asked to face the reckoning even after we turn into dust and bones
He would be asked, "Would you look at him now
He would look and spot his ex-friend in the thick of the blazing fire
He would call out (to his ex friend in the hellfire), "I swear by Allah, you had all but ruined me
Had it not been for my Lord´s blessings, I would be there (burning in the hellfire) with you, right now
(Happily, he would muse), "Are we never going to die now
Was our death in our previous life final? Are we never going to be punished
That, indeed, is a tremendous triumph
Those desirous (of success) should strive for just such an outcome
Isn´t a gracious feast (in paradise) better than the tree of ´zaqum´
We have deemed that tree to be a test for the evildoers
That tree springs forth from the very bottom of hell
Its buds (and crop) resemble the heads of Shaitans
The evil doers will have (nothing but) that to eat. They will stuff their stomachs with it
They will get (only) boiling water (to gulp down the ´zaqum´)
After (such a meal) they will come right back to the blazing fire of hell
(Their crime): they found their parents astray
Yet (without thinking) they rushed along in their (parents´) footsteps
(Even though they knew that) the earlier people (blundered and) had gone astray
We certainly raised messengers among them to warn them
So look at how those people forewarned met their end. The fate that they fared
But the sincere and the obedient servants of Allah (will be safe)
Earlier, Nooh called Us and We responded. We are simply the Best of those who respond
We rescued him and his household from an awful torture
We arranged it so that only his progeny survived (the flood)
And among the generations to follow, We let his name be honored and revered
Peace (and honor) is for ´Nooh´ in the entire universe
This is really how We reward the righteous ones
Indeed, he was one of Our (obedient and) believing servants
We drowned the others _ all the rest of them
Among those who followed him and his ways, was Ibraheem
He brought back to his Lord an untainted (and unblemished) heart, free from evil
He said to his father and his people, "What do you worship? (These idols)
Do you prefer lies? Do you seek false gods instead of Allah
Is this your notion of the Lord of the universe
Then he (rolled his eyes and) cast a sweeping glance at the stars
And said, "I really feel sick
So they turned their backs and left him alone
Stealthily, he approached their gods and said, "Why do you not eat (the offerings)
What is wrong? You don´t even talk
And then he attacked them, striking sharp blows with his right hand
The worshippers came rushing towards him
He asked, "You worship these idols? You have carved them yourself (they are your handiwork)
While you _ as also your handiwork _ are the creation of Allah
They said, "Let us build a (furnace shaped) pyre for him, and let us toss him into the blazing fire (burning inside)
Skillfully, they devised a plan against him, but We made their plans go awry and We humiliated them. We brought them down
(After his rescue) he said, "I am going towards my Lord! He will guide me
My Lord, grant me a righteous (son)
So We gave him the glad tidings of a gentle lad

When that boy was old enough to share his father´s interests, Ibraheem said, "Oh my son, in my dream I saw myself slaughtering you (by His command)! So now, tell me what you think?" The son said, "Oh my father, do carry out your command. You will find me _ if Allah so wills _ patient and steadfast
When both agreed to submit (their wills to Allah), the father flung his son down on his face
That is when We called out, "Oh Ibraheem
You have made this dream come true! We reward the righteous ones in this manner
In fact, this was meant to be a clear (and specific) trial for you
Therefore, We offered in exchange (for his son) the great sacrifice (the rite of sacrifice on the day after Hajj)
And among the generations to follow We let his name be honored and revered
Peace is upon Ibraheem
This is how We reward the righteous ones
Indeed, he was one of Our (obedient and) believing servants
We gave him the good news of the birth of Ishaq _ a righteous prophet
We blessed him and Ishaq. Now, some of their descendants are righteous, while others (disbelieved and so) are unjust to their own selves
And We certainly bestowed Our favor upon Musa, and (his brother) Haroon
And We rescued them, and their nation, from an awful torture
And We came to their aid. So they ended up being the victors
And We gave them the divine book (so they may know right from wrong)
And We guided them to the straight path
And among the generations to follow, We let their names be honored and revered
Peace is upon Musa and Haroon
This is really how We reward the righteous ones
Those two were among Our (obedient and) believing servants
And Ilyas, too, was one of the messengers
He said to his people, "Do you not fear Allah
Do you pray to (the idol) ´Baal´ (a bull believed to be a god of fertility) while you quit (worshipping) the Best of the creators
Allah, your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers
But they (disbelieved and) called him a liar. Therefore, they will certainly be present there (on the Day of Judgment to face the punishment)
Except the sincere servants of Allah
And among the generations to follow, We let his name be honored and revered
Peace be upon Ilyas
This is really how We reward the righteous ones
Indeed, he was one of Our (obedient and) believing servants
´Loot´ was also one of the messengers
We rescued him and all the members of his family
Except an old woman destined to stay behind
Then We destroyed the others _ all the rest of them
In fact, you do pass by their ruins during the day
And during the night! Don´t you have any sense
And surely, Yunus was also one of the messengers
He (abandoned his post and) fled aboard a crowded ship
(To save the ship) he agreed to take part in the casting of the lots _ and lost. (Hence, he was thrown overboard)
A whale swallowed him. He was (at fault and) blame worthy
He was one of those who (extol and) glorify Allah routinely
Else, he would have stayed in the belly of the fish till the day of resurrection
But We tossed him ashore in a barren area without any shade. He was stricken with illness and emaciated
We grew a plant _ a creeper _ over and around (to shade and protect) him
(Later), We sent him back to the community of a hundred thousand plus
They believed, so We had them enjoy life for a while
Ask their opinion. (Is it fair that) your Lord should have daughters while they prefer sons for themselves
Or did We create the angels as female beings? Were they present there, watching
Beware! What they utter is certainly self-conceived, and merely fiction
(Do they say) Allah has borne a child? Of course they are lying
Does He (really) prefer daughters over sons
What is wrong with you? How can you hold such views
Won´t you (reflect and) come back to your senses
Or do you have a clear authority (to hold such views)
So bring your scriptures (and quote your authority) if you are truthful
They conjure up kinship between Him and the jinn. But (all) jinn are well aware that the evildoers will have to appear before Him (for reckoning)
Allah is Exalted _ infinitely more Sublime than what they describe
The sincere servants of Allah are excepted _ (they associate no one with Allah)
Of course you and those (false gods) you worship
Can never tempt and entice away
Anybody except the one who will burn in the fire of hell
(The angels say) "Every single one of us has been assigned a place
(Before Him). We, too stand in rows to pray
We, too, (extol His glory and) chant His praises
They surely used to claim (that)
Like the earlier people, if we had received the (divine) advice
Then of course we would have been the chosen people of Allah
(Divine advice they did receive), but they have rejected it already! So now, they will soon find out
We already gave Our word to Our servants _ the messengers
That they would certainly be helped
Our army would triumph, for sure
So leave them alone for a while
Just watch them. Soon they will see the torment themselves
Are they clamoring for Our torment to be hastened
For those forewarned, dreadful would be the dawn when the doom descends on their doorstep
So leave them alone for a while
Watch them! Soon they will see it
Glorified is your Lord, the Majestic Lord of honor and power. (He is Free) from the lies they attribute to Him
Peace is upon the messengers
And all praise is for Allah, the Lord of the universe
Suad! (Allah swears) by the Qur´an, which is full of (divine) advice
In fact, the unbelievers are steeped in arrogance and aversion
Many generations have We destroyed prior to them. (In the end) they all cried out and pleaded (to be saved); but then it is too late to escape
They consider it odd that a warner has come to them from amongst themselves. The unbelievers said, "This is a magician, a liar
Has he replaced all our gods with just One God? That is really astounding
Their chiefs go about saying, "Go home and hold on to your gods staunchly. This thing is (purposely) designed (against you)
We have never heard any such thing in other nations, lately. This is nothing but a made up story
Why was the (divine) advice revealed to him (and not us)? Among us, (why was he chosen)?" No! Rather, it is My advice that they doubt (and challenge). In fact, they have not tasted My punishment yet
Do they have _ to own (and to distribute) _ the treasures of the mercy of your Powerful Lord, the Generous Grantor of gifts

Or do they own the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and everything in between? So, let them ascend up (to the heaven) by their means. (Alternate meaning: So, let them rise to the top of this world)
They are just one small group out of many (that were bigger and much stronger). They are (destined) to be routed right here (on their home turf)
Prior to them, many (groups) rejected the messengers, like the nation of Nooh, the ´Aads´ and the pharaoh _ the one so firmly fortified
(And like) the Samood, the nation of Loot, and the people of ´Aikah´. (Now), they were (much stronger) groups
Every single one of them rejected the messenger, and so justly deserved My punishment
Now, what these people here (have been warned about and) are waiting for is nothing but a single mighty blast. There won´t be (the need for) a second blast
They say, "Our Lord, rush our share (of the punishment) to us right now, before the day of reckoning
Bear everything they say patiently (oh prophet), and remember Our servant Da´ood, the one with strength. He constantly turned to Allah (for guidance)
We tamed the mountains for him. Every nightfall and morning, they sang along the praises (of Allah) with him
Birds used to gather around. They all turned to Him (and chanted His praises)
We strengthened his domain and granted him wisdom, and (eloquent) persuasive speech
Has the tale of the two litigants reached you? They scaled the wall (of the palace to gain entry) into the royal chambers

Da´ood was scared when they entered his room. They said, "Do not be afraid. The two of us have a dispute. One of us has unjustly harmed the other. So, settle our dispute fairly. Do not stray from the just course. Guide us to the right path

One of them said, "This, here, is my brother. He had ninety-nine lambs, while I had only one lamb. Yet he said to me, ´Hand over your lamb to me.´ He persuaded (and prevailed over) me with his (eloquent) speech

(Da´ood) said, "He certainly wronged you by asking for your lamb to join his herd (of ninety-nine lambs). Indeed, most friends and family members often treat each other unjustly, except those who believe and perform righteous deeds. Such ones (however) are few." And then Da´ood realized, that We had put him through a test (by this incident). So, he sought forgiveness of his Lord. He fell down prostrate and turned to Him in repentance
So We forgave him. Indeed, he has a high status with Us _ an excellent place to return

(We said), "Oh Da´ood, We have certainly appointed you Our deputy in the land. Therefore, settle the disputes between people with justice. Do not be swayed by your whims and wishes. Else, you will stray from the path of Allah. Indeed, there is a severe punishment for those who stray from the path of Allah _ because they forget the day of reckoning

We did not create this _ the heaven, the earth and everything in between _ without a purpose. (In fact) those who do not believe, think otherwise. Misery is for the unbelievers. They will be in fire (forever)
Should We make those who believe and perform good deeds share the same fate as those who spread corruption in this world? Should We treat the righteous ones and the wicked ones alike
(Oh prophet)! We have revealed to you a book full of blessings, so that people may ponder over its verses, and so that those with sense and insight may heed its advice
To Da´ood We gave (a son), Sulaiman. What a wonderful (person and a) servant (of Allah)! Indeed, he (frequently) turned (to Allah) in repentance
One day in the late afternoon, swift-footed highbred horses were presented to him

He said, "I relished (and indulged in) these good things (of this world), and failed to remember my Lord. (He missed the evening prayer). When the horses (ran and) vanished from sight behind the screen (of dust they kicked off), he ordered
Bring them back to me!" He began to slash their legs and napes (with his sword)

We certainly put Sulaiman through a test. We raised (his heir) to the throne to be just a figure _ just a body (inept and incompetent). Then He repented and turned back (from his desire to bequeath the throne to one of his own descendants)
He said, "My Lord, grant me forgiveness! Grant me an empire, the like of which no one shall ever have after me. Certainly, You are the (real) Grantor
So We gave him control over the wind. Upon his orders, it gently sped towards the region of his choice
(And under his control, We placed) the Shaitans _ all the builders and the divers
And others bound in chains
(We said) "This is Our gift to you! Without (the fear of) reckoning, you may bestow it _ or hold it back _ upon whomever you wish
Indeed, he has a high status with Us, and an excellent place to return
And remember Our servant Ayub. He called his Lord (saying), "Shaitan really heckles me (with doubts; I am stricken) with hardship and distress
(We said), "With your foot, stamp the ground; (under it is a spring), cool water to bathe and drink
We gave his family back to him. And as a blessing from Us, We gave him many more (children) _ a reminder for those who reflect

(We said to Ayub) "Do not break your oath. (Instead) take a bundle of thin grass and with it (lightly) strike (the person you swore to lash; you were sick at that time)." We really found him patient. What a wonderful person! Indeed, he constantly turned to Us in repentance
And remember Our servant Ibraheem, Ishaq and Yaqub. They all had insight and the strength of character
We especially chose them because they (always) remembered the house of the hereafter
According to Our judgment, they were certainly among the best, the excellent
And remember Ismail, ´Al-yasaa´ and ´Dhul-Kifl´. They are all among the excellent ones
This (Qur´an) is a reminder! Indeed, for the righteous one there is an excellent place to go to (after death)
Eternal paradise! With its gates held open for them (allowing them free and unhindered access)
There, seated comfortably, they would order and receive (exotic and) plentiful fruits and drinks
With them, would be the chaste females of the same age _ those with eyes only for their mates
(They would be told) "All this was promised to be yours on the day of reckoning
Certainly, such is Our grant to you! It will never run out
All that (is for the righteous)! But for the transgressors, there is a worst place to return
Hell, which will roast them! An abominable abode
(It is appropriate for them)! So let them quench their thirst with boiling water, pus and discharge from wounds
And other (despicable) torments of that sort
(As the fresh crop of unbelievers is hurled into hell, those already there will say), "This is the group entering (hell) to stay. No welcome for them! They shall burn in the fire
(The newcomers will respond) "Actually there is no welcome for you either. You led us here into hell, the worst of the places
They will say, "Our Lord, increase the torment by fire twice as much for the one who has brought this (fate) upon us
They will say, "What is the matter? We don´t see here (in hell) those men we used to consider wicked (in the previous life)
We had made them the target of ridicule! Why do our eyes fail to spot them (here)
Definitely! That is the truth! Those in hellfire will bicker and wrangle (just like that)
Say (oh prophet)! "Actually, I am only a warner! There is no god but Allah, the One and Only, the Almighty
The Sustainer of the heavens and the earth and everything in between, the most Powerful and the most Forgiving
Say, "That is the greatest news
You are turning away from it
I had no knowledge of the high chiefs, (the angels), as they discussed among themselves (the creation of Adam)
This was revealed to me (for no other reason) except that I am really _ and clearly _ a warner
Your Lord said to the angels, "I am really going to create man from clay
You must fall down prostrate before him (in submission), after I have fashioned him and have breathed into him the spirit created by Me
Accordingly, the angels _ all of them together _ fell prostrate
But Iblees (the Shaitan) did not! He displayed arrogance, and was (always) a disbeliever
(Allah) said, "Oh Iblees, what kept you from falling prostrate before a being I created with My hands? Are you too proud (to bow)? Or are you one of the high and the exalted
(Iblees) said, "I am better than him. You created me from fire, while You created him from clay
(Allah) said, "Get out of here! Indeed, you are damned
You shall carry My curse till the day of resurrection
(Iblees) said, "My Lord, give me a chance (to prove my point) till the day they shall be raised (back to life)
(Allah) said, "You are (hereby) being granted the respite
Till the day of that appointed time
(Iblees) said, "I swear by Your Might, (oh Lord)! I will definitely tempt and lead all of them astray
Except those among them that are Your true and sincere servants
(Allah said) "The truth is _ and (nothing but) truth I (always) speak
That I will most certainly pack the hellfire with you and all those who follow you
Tell them, "I do not ask of you any compensation. I am not an imposter
It (the Quran) really is a reminder for all the worlds
After a while, you will certainly come to know about it yourself
The revelation (contained) in this book emanates from Allah, the Mighty and the Wise
Indeed, We sent you the book with the truth. So worship Allah, and keep your faith exclusively for Him

Beware! Faith (and religion) made exclusively for Allah is His right. Those who accept patrons other than Allah say, "We do not worship them. But they serve to bring us closer to (and let us concentrate on) Allah." Allah will settle all matters of dispute between people. Indeed, Allah does not guide any ungrateful liar
If Allah (really) wanted to have a son, He could have picked anyone He wanted out of His created beings. Glory be to Him! He is Allah! The Only One, (the Compeller), the Invincible

He created the heavens and the earth with a purpose. He makes the night succeed the day, and He has the day follow the night. He has subjected the sun and the moon (and has pressed them into service) for your sake. Each is afloat for a specified time. Is He not the most Powerful and the oft-Forgiving

He created you (all) from a single being. Out of it, He created its spouse. He gave you eight types (four pairs: males and females of each) of domestic animals _ (sheep, goats, cows and camels). He created you in your mothers´ wombs, shaping you from one form to another _ through three (distinct kinds of) darkened zones. Such is Allah, your Lord! His is the empire (of the entire universe)! There is no god except He! How dare you turn away

If you disbelieve (remember), Allah does not stand in need of you. (But) if you express gratitude, He is pleased with you. No one will carry the burden (of sin) for anybody else. Then, (carrying the load of your own sins) you must journey back to your Lord. He will tell you what you used to do. Indeed, He knows even that which lies (buried) in the chest

When distress befalls man, he calls his Lord in repentance. But he forgets when his Lord (responds and) bestows His blessings _ forgets that he had ever called his Lord. To stray from the (straight) path (and to make others stray from it), he assigns partners for Allah. (Oh Muhammad, SAW) say, "(Stay) in your denial (and) enjoy for a while. You will certainly end up in hell

Could the one who is obedient (ever go to hell)? The one who prostrates before Allah and stands (in prayers) during all of hours of the night? The one who dreads the afterlife and hopes for the mercy of his Lord? Ask (them), "Can those who know, be equal to the ones who do not?" In fact, only the sensible ones heed (the advice)

Say, "Fear your Lord, oh servants (of Allah) who believe! The favorable outcome is for those who perform good deeds in this life. Allah´s land is spacious. Those who endure patiently would, in fact, be (compensated well and) rewarded in full without any reckoning
Say, "I have been ordered to worship Allah (exclusively), keeping my religion exclusively for Him
I have been ordered to be the first to submit and surrender
Indeed, I fear the punishment of that mighty day, in case I disobey my Lord
Limiting my religion exclusively for Him, it is Allah Whom I worship

You may worship others besides Him if you want." Say (further that), "The worst of the losers are those who make their families _ and themselves _ suffer severe losses on the Day of Judgment. Beware! That is evidently the greatest loss
Sheets of blazing fire will blanket them from above, and a raging fire will engulf them from below. Regarding this, Allah cautions His servants, "Oh my servants, fear Me
There is good news for those who shun the worship of false gods _ (the epitome of transgression) _ and turn to Allah in repentance. So let My servants hear the glad tidings
Those who heed the advice, and implement its best features are the ones whom Allah has guided! Such are the sensible ones
The one who deserves the sentence of the (eternal) punishment (cannot be helped). Can you rescue the one who is (as good as) in the fire

For those who fear their Lord, there exist lofty mansions with (several) floors built one atop another, and with rivers running right through. (That is) Allah´s promise! And Allah does not back out of His promise

Do you not see that Allah sends water down from the sky? Then, He channels it into rivers and springs across the earth, and produces with it vegetation of all different (kinds and) colors. But then it withers and you see it fade and (turn) yellow. Later, He turns it into chaff. Indeed, there is a lesson in it for any sensible person

Allah has rendered the hearts (of some of His servants) receptive for Islam. They follow the illumilating guidance of their Lord. Can they be like the unbelievers? Misery is for those whose hearts harden up even more by the mention of Allah. They indeed are clearly on the wrong path

Allah has revealed the very best of the narrative. The oft-repeated contents of this book are coherent, consistent and coupled _ (the promise of rewards is coupled with the threat of punishment). Those who fear their Lord are awestruck by it. Their flesh shudders with fright, and their hearts and souls become mellow with the remembrance of Allah. Such is the guidance of Allah! He guides whomever He wants! There is no guide for the one whom Allah leads astray

So, (imagine the plight of) the one who will _ (being helpless) on the Day of Judgment _ bear the punishment right smack on his face. The evildoers would be told, "Here, taste what you have wrought upon yourself
The earlier people had rejected. As a result, punishment came to them from where they least expected
Thus, Allah had them taste the shame of disgrace in the life of this world, and of course the punishment of the afterlife is much worse. If only they had realized
Indeed, We have placed in this Qur´an various kinds of examples before the people. Perhaps, they will reflect
The Qur´an is in Arabic; (it is simple), without any distortion or deviation. Perhaps they will fear Him

Allah quotes an example. (There are two slaves), one belongs to many partners pitted against each other, while the other belongs entirely to one master. Can these two men fare equally? All praise is for Allah! But most people do not realize
(Oh prophet)! Of course you will die! And for sure, they will die too
Then, on the Day of Judgment you all would place your disputes before your Lord
